article_title: HHS Report Repudiates Dire Warnings About Premiums Spiking Under Health Law
article_text:
HHS Report Repudiates Dire Warnings About Premiums Spiking Under Health Law

Premiums have gone up 8 percent, and when subsidies were factored in the increase was even smaller at 4 percent. The report counters predictions that premiums would see double-digit jumps.

The Hill: HHS Report: Dire Warnings Of ObamaCare Price Spikes Wrong

A new report from the Obama administration finds that ObamaCare premiums rose 8 percent last year, pushing back on warnings of larger price hikes. The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) report released Tuesday finds that ObamaCare premiums rose 8 percent on average — from $356 a month to $386 a month — from 2015 to 2016. (Sullivan, 4/12)

The Hill: HHS Report: Dire Warnings Of ObamaCare Price Spikes WrongA new report from the Obama administration finds that ObamaCare premiums rose 8 percent last year, pushing back on warnings of larger price hikes.
The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) report released Tuesday finds that ObamaCare premiums rose 8 percent on average — from $356 a month to $386 a month — from 2015 to 2016.
The report counters predictions that premiums would see double-digit jumps.
